scope.description: Baseline engineering requirements library (superset) for nuclear pressurizers used to control reactor coolant system pressure and provide interfaces for overpressure protection and inventory management. Applicability is filtered by a PressurizerProfile and project licensing basis.
scope.licensing_basis_assumption: US NRC-style framework (10 CFR Part 50/52) with code-of-record per 10 CFR 50.55a where applicable.
notes: This library is intentionally a superset. Not every requirement applies to every pressurizer design (separate vessel vs integral, spray vs no-spray, PORV vs safety-valve-only, etc.).
Clause-level traceability (e.g., exact ASME/NRC clause IDs) is expected to be added once the standards database is ingested and indexed.
Parameter placeholders use double curly braces (e.g., {{design_pressure}}) and are intended to be populated by downstream tooling.

requirements.text: The project shall define and record the licensing basis and code-of-record for the pressurizer, including applicable regulations, incorporated codes/standards, and edition/addenda where required.

verification.acceptance: Documented licensing basis and code-of-record exists and is under configuration control.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall be classified (e.g., ASME class, safety classification, QA level, seismic category) consistent with system safety functions and the facility design basis.

verification.acceptance: Classification basis is documented and traceable to system safety functions and licensing basis.

requirements.text: A pressurizer design specification shall be issued that defines functional requirements for pressure control, inventory management, overpressure protection interfaces, and monitoring.

verification.acceptance: Controlled design specification exists with traceability to system requirements.

requirements.text: Design inputs (loads, transients, environmental conditions, seismic inputs, chemistry limits, and setpoints) shall be identified, verified, and controlled before design finalization.

verification.acceptance: Design inputs are defined, verified, and version-controlled; changes are managed via formal change control.

requirements.text: The pressurizer design shall satisfy applicable General Design Criteria related to reactor coolant pressure boundary integrity, pressure control, and safety system support functions.

verification.acceptance: Design basis mapping demonstrates applicable GDCs are addressed by requirements and design features.

requirements.text: A list of design-basis transients and events applicable to the pressurizer (including heatup/cooldown, insurge/outsurge, spray transients, and pressure relief events) shall be established.

verification.acceptance: Transient list is defined, justified, and used consistently in stress/fatigue and performance analyses.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall be designed for a design life of at least {{design_life_years}} years under the defined operating profile and transients.

verification.acceptance: Design life basis and fatigue/aging evaluations support the specified design life.

requirements.text: Human factors and operability requirements for pressure and level control (alarms, indications, control actions, and operator burden) shall be identified and incorporated.

verification.acceptance: Operating concepts and HFE considerations are documented and reflected in controls/alarms and procedures.

requirements.text: A configuration management plan shall control pressurizer design documents, setpoints, software/firmware affecting safety functions, and as-built records.

verification.acceptance: CM plan exists; changes are tracked with approvals, verification, and traceability.

requirements.text: A supplier qualification and commercial-grade dedication approach (as applicable) shall be defined for pressurizer procured items, including heaters and instrumentation.

verification.acceptance: Procurement QA approach is documented and applied to purchase specifications and supplier evaluations.

requirements.text: Records necessary to support regulatory compliance (design reports, material certs, welding/NDE records, test results, and nonconformance dispositions) shall be generated and retained for {{document_retention_years}} years or as required by the licensing basis.

verification.acceptance: Required records are identified, complete, retrievable, and retained per retention plan.

requirements.text: A cybersecurity classification and boundary for pressurizer-related instrumentation and controls shall be defined consistent with the plant cyber security program.

verification.acceptance: Cybersecurity zone and applicable controls are identified for pressurizer I&C assets.

requirements.text: A design review and independent verification plan shall be implemented for pressurizer safety-significant analyses (stress, fatigue, fracture, relief capacity, and control logic).

verification.acceptance: Independent review/verification evidence exists for designated analyses and design outputs.

requirements.text: The pressurizer requirements shall include maintainability provisions for heater replacement, instrument calibration, insulation removal, and weld/inspection access.

verification.acceptance: Maintainability requirements are present and verified against layout/access provisions.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall have a defined set of acceptance criteria for pressure control performance, leakage, and relief system functional response during commissioning.

verification.acceptance: Commissioning acceptance criteria are documented and traceable to plant operating limits and design assumptions.

requirements.text: A foreign material exclusion (FME) and cleanliness program shall be specified for pressurizer fabrication, installation, and maintenance activities.

verification.acceptance: FME/cleanliness requirements are defined and implemented in procedures and inspections.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall be included in the plant aging management and condition monitoring strategy, with defined inspection/monitoring scope and acceptance limits.

verification.acceptance: Aging management inputs (inspection, monitoring, evaluation methods) are documented for the pressurizer.

requirements.text: Interfaces between pressurizer controls and the plant protection/limiting systems shall be documented, including setpoints, permissives, and interlocks.

verification.acceptance: Interface control document defines signals, setpoints, and interlocks with verification evidence.

requirements.text: The pressurizer design shall incorporate lessons learned and operating experience screening for pressurizer heaters, spray/relief transients, and nozzle fatigue (as applicable).

verification.acceptance: Operating experience review is documented and dispositions are reflected in design requirements or features.

requirements.text: Any deviations from code-of-record requirements (e.g., alternative methods, code cases, relief requests) shall be identified, justified, and tracked as controlled regulatory commitments.

verification.acceptance: Deviations and their approvals/commitments are documented and traceable to affected requirements and design outputs.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall be integrated with the Reactor Coolant System (RCS) via a surge line sized {{surge_line_dn}} and configured to support required insurge/outsurge flows while limiting thermal stratification and fatigue at the surge line nozzle.

verification.acceptance: Surge line sizing/configuration and nozzle fatigue/thermal evaluations demonstrate acceptable performance and margins.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide nozzle connections for spray, relief discharge, vent, drain, instrumentation, and auxiliary connections as required by the plant design specification.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle schedule and interface drawings show all required connections with sizes, ratings, and identification.

requirements.text: Nozzle locations and orientations shall be designed to minimize local thermal stresses, avoid adverse flow impingement, and enable inspection and maintenance access.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle layout analysis and 3D layout review confirm stress/impingement controls and access clearances.

requirements.text: Interface loads and boundary conditions (deadweight, thermal expansion, seismic, LOCA/HELB, and transient loads) at each nozzle shall be defined and used in pressurizer structural evaluations.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle load tables exist and are traceable to piping/dynamic analyses and used in vessel/nozzle evaluations.

requirements.text: Pressurizer support interfaces (skirt, lugs, or integral supports) shall be designed to accommodate thermal growth and to transfer operational and seismic loads to the supporting structure.

verification.acceptance: Support design calculations and drawings demonstrate load capacity and thermal growth accommodation.

requirements.text: Electrical penetrations and power interfaces for heaters shall be defined, including voltage {{heater_voltage}}, power distribution, grounding, and environmental/seismic qualification class.

verification.acceptance: Electrical interface documentation defines power/grounding and qualification basis for penetrations and heater circuits.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions for lifting, rigging, and handling during installation and maintenance, including certified lift points where required.

verification.acceptance: Lift points/handling features are specified, analyzed, and verified by inspection/load test as applicable.

requirements.text: Thermal insulation interfaces (attachment features, removable sections, and clearances) shall be defined to support heat loss limits and inspection access.

verification.acceptance: Insulation design shows attachment details, removable panels, and clearance/access for ISI and maintenance.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide drain and vent provisions that support system fill, venting, chemistry control, and safe maintenance isolations.

verification.acceptance: Drain/vent connections and procedures enable fill/vent/drain operations without air binding or trapping unacceptable volumes.

requirements.text: Interfaces to pressurizer relief discharge handling (e.g., relief tank, piping, quench/sparger, and drainage) shall be defined to prevent unacceptable backpressure and dynamic loads.

verification.acceptance: Relief discharge design maintains backpressure below {{relief_discharge_backpressure_limit}} MPa and controls water hammer/loads.

requirements.text: Instrumentation penetrations shall be arranged to minimize leak paths, allow calibration/removal, and maintain pressure boundary integrity.

verification.acceptance: Penetration design details demonstrate integrity and maintainability; leak-tightness features are specified.

requirements.text: The pressurizer layout shall maintain required separation and protection from external hazards (flooding, fire, missile/pipe whip, and high-energy line break) consistent with plant design basis.

verification.acceptance: Hazard analyses and layout demonstrate required separation/protection measures are implemented.

requirements.text: Interfaces with plant chemistry and sampling systems shall be defined such that pressurizer inventory can be sampled/monitored without adversely impacting pressure control.

verification.acceptance: Sampling interface is defined; evaluation shows sampling does not violate pressure/level control limits.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall support planned maintenance and outage operations by providing access envelopes and laydown space requirements for heater bundle removal and instrument work.

verification.acceptance: Layout/access review confirms maintenance envelopes and handling paths are available.

requirements.text: The pressurizer design shall include identification and tagging requirements for nozzles, penetrations, heaters, and instrumentation channels for configuration control and maintenance.

verification.acceptance: Tagging/labeling scheme is defined and applied in drawings/specs and as-built records.

requirements.text: Interfaces between pressurizer pressure/level control and reactor coolant charging/letdown systems shall be defined to avoid control interaction and instability.

verification.acceptance: Control interaction analysis demonstrates stable operation across operating modes and transients.

requirements.text: Where the pressurizer is integral to the reactor vessel or module (pressurizer_design=integral), module interface requirements (access, welds, transport constraints, and installation tolerances) shall be specified.

verification.acceptance: Module interface requirements and analyses exist and are reflected in design and installation plans.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall be compatible with plant transient mitigation features (e.g., automatic depressurization, feed-and-bleed, or controlled cooldown) as applicable to the design basis.

verification.acceptance: Interfaces and operating strategies are documented and validated against transient analyses.

requirement_sets.category: 3. Design conditions, operating envelope, and pressure control performance

requirements.text: The pressurizer pressure boundary shall be designed for a design pressure of at least {{design_pressure}} MPa, including allowances for overpressure events and uncertainties per the design specification.

verification.acceptance: Design pressure basis and ASME design report demonstrate adequate margin to specified design pressure.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall be designed for a design temperature of at least {{design_temperature}} °C for all pressure boundary materials and welds.

verification.acceptance: Material allowables and design report demonstrate compliance at the specified design temperature.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall maintain the normal pressure setpoint {{normal_pressure_setpoint}} MPa within a control band of ±{{pressure_control_band}} MPa during steady-state operation.

verification.acceptance: Control logic and commissioning test demonstrate pressure regulation within the specified band under steady-state conditions.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide sufficient heater capacity {{heater_power_total}} MW to restore pressure following insurge and heat loss conditions within the required response time.

verification.acceptance: Thermal-hydraulic model and functional testing demonstrate heater capacity meets response requirements.

requirements.text: Heater power shall be controllable in discrete groups ({{heater_group_count}} groups) with step size not exceeding {{heater_step_power}} MW per step to support stable control and minimize overshoot.

verification.acceptance: Design documentation and control testing demonstrate grouped control capability and step size constraints.

requirements.text: If a spray system is provided, the pressurizer shall provide a maximum spray flow of at least {{spray_flow_max}} kg/s to control pressure during outsurg e and heatup transients.

verification.acceptance: Hydraulic sizing and functional testing demonstrate spray flow capacity and response.

requirements.text: The pressurizer total volume shall be at least {{total_volume_m3}} m³ and configured to support required insurge/outsurge volumes without violating level and pressure limits.

verification.acceptance: Volume/inventory analysis demonstrates compliance with level/pressure limits for defined transients.

requirements.text: The pressurizer vapor space volume shall be sufficient (≥ {{vapor_space_volume_m3}} m³) to dampen pressure transients and support stable pressure control.

verification.acceptance: Transient analysis demonstrates vapor space provides adequate damping and control stability.

requirements.text: Normal operating level {{normal_level_percent}}% and control range {{level_control_range_percent}}% shall be defined to maintain heater coverage and spray effectiveness across operating modes.

verification.acceptance: Level control setpoints and functional tests demonstrate heaters remain adequately covered and spray performance is maintained.

requirements.text: Pressurizer level and pressure operating limits shall be established to prevent uncovering heaters, exceeding nozzle thermal limits, or exceeding relief system capacity.

verification.acceptance: Operating limits are defined and justified by analyses and are reflected in plant procedures/TS where applicable.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall accommodate insurge volume ≥ {{insurge_capacity_m3}} m³ without exceeding the high pressure trip {{high_pressure_trip}} MPa.

verification.acceptance: Insurge transient analysis demonstrates high pressure trip is not exceeded for defined insurge events.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall accommodate outsurg e volume ≥ {{outsurge_capacity_m3}} m³ without dropping below the low pressure trip {{low_pressure_trip}} MPa.

verification.acceptance: Outsurge transient analysis demonstrates low pressure trip is not exceeded for defined outsurg e events.

requirements.text: Maximum heatup and cooldown rates ({{max_heatup_rate}} °C/hr and {{max_cooldown_rate}} °C/hr) for the pressurizer shall be specified and supported by thermal stress and fatigue evaluations.

verification.acceptance: Thermal stress and fatigue analyses support specified heatup/cooldown rate limits.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include design provisions to minimize thermal stratification and to manage steam/water interface behavior during low-flow and spray transients.

verification.acceptance: Thermal-hydraulic/stratification evaluation demonstrates acceptable temperature gradients and fatigue impacts.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide a defined non-condensable gas management approach ({{steam_space_noncondensable_control}}) to support pressure control and chemistry requirements.

verification.acceptance: Design documents define gas management approach and demonstrate it supports pressure/chemistry objectives.

requirements.text: Heat losses from the pressurizer (including attached surge/spray lines within the insulation boundary) shall not exceed {{heat_loss_max}} kW under steady-state conditions.

verification.acceptance: Heat loss calculations and, where practical, commissioning measurements demonstrate compliance with heat loss limit.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall maintain pressure control stability without sustained oscillations for expected ranges of charging/letdown flow and reactor power conditions.

verification.acceptance: Control stability analysis and commissioning testing demonstrate stable pressure response without sustained oscillations.

requirements.text: The pressurizer design shall consider hydrogen/boron effects on boiling behavior and heater surface conditions within the defined chemistry program.

verification.acceptance: Design/operability evaluation demonstrates chemistry impacts are considered and controlled.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide sufficient steam space and geometry to limit moisture carryover into relief lines during relief events, consistent with discharge system assumptions.

verification.acceptance: Relief transient evaluation demonstrates acceptable carryover assumptions and discharge system compatibility.

requirements.text: Where pressurizer is integral (pressurizer_design=integral), pressure control performance shall be demonstrated across module operating envelopes including startup/shutdown and low inventory modes.

verification.acceptance: Module-level analyses and tests demonstrate pressure control meets requirements across operating envelope.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions to prevent water hammer in spray and relief paths through line routing, venting, and operating procedures.

verification.acceptance: Water hammer assessment demonstrates controls and design features reduce risk to acceptable levels.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include design features to minimize crud/deposit accumulation at heater sleeves and spray nozzles, consistent with primary chemistry guidance.

verification.acceptance: Design review confirms features/materials/flows mitigate deposit accumulation consistent with chemistry program.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide defined provisions for initial fill and heatup that avoid trapped gas pockets and ensure stable steam bubble formation.

verification.acceptance: Startup procedure and system venting analysis/test demonstrate stable steam bubble formation without unacceptable gas trapping.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall be designed such that normal operating temperature {{normal_operating_temp}} °C is within allowable limits for seals/penetrations and insulation design.

verification.acceptance: Component selections and design evaluations demonstrate compatibility with normal operating temperature.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall maintain controllable pressure and level behavior during low power and shutdown conditions, including minimum charging/letdown flow conditions defined in the operating profile.

verification.acceptance: Control analysis and commissioning/shutdown testing demonstrate stable control at low power/shutdown conditions.

requirement_sets.category: 4. Pressure boundary integrity and structural design

requirements.text: The pressurizer pressure boundary shall be designed, fabricated, examined, tested, and stamped in accordance with ASME Section III requirements for the specified code class (typically {{code_class}}).

verification.acceptance: ASME Section III design report and data package demonstrate compliance and required code stamp is applied.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall meet ASME Section III stress limits for all load combinations, including pressure, deadweight, thermal, seismic, and transient loads defined in the design specification.

verification.acceptance: Stress reports show compliance with Section III allowable limits for required service levels and load combinations.

requirements.text: Nozzles and penetrations shall include reinforcement and local stress evaluation per code to ensure structural integrity under specified loads and moments.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle reinforcement and local stress analyses demonstrate code compliance for each nozzle/penetration.

requirements.text: The design shall account for thermal transients and local temperature gradients at surge, spray, and relief nozzles, including the use of thermal sleeves or mixing devices where required.

verification.acceptance: Thermal transient evaluation demonstrates acceptable stresses/fatigue and confirms need and adequacy of thermal sleeves/mixers.

requirements.text: If a surge line thermal sleeve is provided, it shall be designed to prevent excessive vibration, wear, and differential thermal expansion issues.

verification.acceptance: Sleeve design analysis demonstrates acceptable clearances, vibration margins, and thermal expansion compatibility.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions to prevent brittle fracture, including material toughness requirements, RTNDT/Charpy controls, and a pressure-temperature limits program.

verification.acceptance: Material toughness documentation and P-T limits demonstrate adequate margins against brittle fracture.

requirements.text: Fracture toughness and flaw evaluation methodology for the pressurizer shall be defined and applied consistent with the code class and licensing basis.

verification.acceptance: Fracture evaluation basis and results are documented for relevant regions (beltline, nozzles, penetrations).

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall be designed to withstand design-basis accident (DBA) loads and combinations applicable to its location and function (e.g., LOCA-induced loads, pressure relief loads, and HELB effects).

verification.acceptance: DBA load evaluations demonstrate structural adequacy and functional performance for required combinations.

requirements.text: Support and anchorage design shall demonstrate adequate margins under SSE input {{sse_peak_g}} g and associated combinations, including sliding/uplift prevention where required.

verification.acceptance: Seismic support calculations demonstrate capacity and acceptable anchorage margins; required hold-down features are provided.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall maintain leak-tight integrity under normal and upset conditions, with leakage limited to ≤ {{leak_rate_limit}} kg/h where specified.

verification.acceptance: Leak testing and inspection demonstrate leakage does not exceed specified limit under test conditions.

requirements.text: Design shall address nozzle-to-shell and penetration weld residual stresses, including requirements for PWHT where required by material and thickness.

verification.acceptance: Weld procedures and stress relief requirements (PWHT) are specified and supported by code requirements.

requirements.text: Weld overlay repairs and cladding repairs (if allowed) shall be qualified and evaluated to maintain structural integrity and corrosion protection.

verification.acceptance: Repair methods are qualified and evaluated; repaired regions meet design and corrosion protection requirements.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include allowance for thermal expansion and differential movement between vessel, supports, and attached piping to prevent overstress and binding.

verification.acceptance: Thermal expansion analyses demonstrate acceptable stresses and clearances for vessel/support/piping interactions.

requirements.text: Any bolted closures or manways (if provided) shall be designed for pressure, temperature, and cyclic service, including gasket selection and bolt preload controls.

verification.acceptance: Closure design meets code requirements; gasket/bolting specs support leak-tightness across cycles.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include a load path and restraint strategy to address pipe whip/jet impingement or other dynamic hazards applicable to adjacent high-energy piping.

verification.acceptance: Dynamic hazard analysis demonstrates restraints/protection features are adequate for applicable scenarios.

requirements.text: The pressurizer design shall include provisions to prevent unacceptable vibration of internal components (heater sleeves, spray nozzles, thermal sleeves) due to flow and pressure fluctuations.

verification.acceptance: Internal component vibration evaluations demonstrate acceptable margins; design features mitigate excitation.

requirements.text: The pressurizer internal surfaces shall be designed to avoid crevices or stagnant regions that can concentrate impurities and accelerate localized corrosion.

verification.acceptance: Design review confirms geometry/finish avoids crevice/stagnation features or provides mitigation.

requirements.text: Cladding and liner (if present) shall be integrated such that differential expansion and mechanical anchoring prevent delamination under thermal cycles.

verification.acceptance: Cladding/liner design and qualification demonstrate resistance to delamination and thermal cycling damage.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions for overpressure test and hydrostatic test without overstressing supports or connected piping.

verification.acceptance: Hydrotest configuration analysis demonstrates loads are acceptable and test can be performed safely.

requirements.text: The pressurizer hydrostatic test pressure shall be at least {{hydrotest_pressure}} MPa and performed in accordance with code requirements.

verification.acceptance: Hydrotest is performed and documented; no unacceptable deformation/leakage is observed; NDE re-exams as required.

requirements.text: Design shall account for external loads from insulation, platforms, and temporary loads during maintenance without violating allowable stresses.

verification.acceptance: External load evaluation demonstrates acceptable stress margins for operational and maintenance configurations.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include monitoring or analysis justification to demonstrate acceptable vibration and fatigue of heater penetrations under plant operating conditions.

verification.acceptance: Penetration fatigue/vibration evaluation demonstrates acceptable margins; monitoring provisions are defined if needed.

requirements.text: For integral pressurizer designs, structural evaluations shall include module transport and handling loads in addition to operational load combinations.

verification.acceptance: Design report includes transport/handling load cases and demonstrates structural adequacy.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include design features to enable periodic revalidation of setpoints and functional capability without compromising pressure boundary integrity.

verification.acceptance: Design includes test connections/arrangements that enable periodic verification activities with controlled risk.

requirements.text: Surge line nozzle geometry (including inner radius ≥ {{surge_line_nozzle_inner_radius_mm}} mm where specified) shall be designed to minimize stress concentration and thermal fatigue susceptibility.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle geometry and fatigue evaluation demonstrate acceptable stress concentration factors and fatigue margins.

requirement_sets.category: 5. Materials selection, cladding, and corrosion/chemistry compatibility

requirements.text: Pressure boundary base materials (e.g., {{shell_material}} and {{nozzle_material}}) shall be selected from qualified ASME Section II materials with documented mechanical properties and toughness for the specified service.

verification.acceptance: Material specifications and certified material test reports (CMTRs) demonstrate compliance with Section II and project toughness requirements.

requirements.text: Wetted surfaces exposed to primary coolant shall have corrosion-resistant cladding or material selection compatible with borated water and hydrogen control chemistry (as applicable).

verification.acceptance: Materials/cladding selections are documented and shown compatible with chemistry program and operating conditions.

requirements.text: Cladding material {{cladding_material}} and minimum thickness {{cladding_thickness_mm}} mm shall be specified and verified to provide corrosion protection and repair allowance where required.

verification.acceptance: Cladding specification and measurement/inspection records demonstrate thickness and material compliance.

requirements.text: Material selection shall minimize susceptibility to primary water stress corrosion cracking (PWSCC) and environmentally-assisted fatigue for relevant alloys and weld metals.

verification.acceptance: Material and weld metal selections are justified against known degradation mechanisms and mitigations are defined.

requirements.text: Cobalt and other activation-prone constituents shall be minimized in wetted materials and hardfacing where practicable to support dose reduction objectives.

verification.acceptance: Procurement specifications and material certifications reflect low-cobalt controls where applicable.

requirements.text: Heater sheath material {{heater_sheath_material}} and heater sleeve material {{heater_sleeve_material}} shall be compatible with pressurizer chemistry and temperature gradients, including crevice conditions at sleeves.

verification.acceptance: Compatibility evaluation demonstrates acceptable corrosion and deposition performance; materials are specified and traceable.

requirements.text: Spray nozzle and spray line materials shall be selected to avoid erosion-corrosion and thermal shock cracking under spray transients.

verification.acceptance: Materials and design features for spray system demonstrate erosion-corrosion resistance and thermal shock margins.

requirements.text: Primary chemistry impurity limits (chloride ≤ {{chloride_limit_ppb}} ppb, fluoride ≤ {{fluoride_limit_ppb}} ppb, oxygen ≤ {{oxygen_limit_ppb}} ppb where specified) shall be established for pressurizer compatibility.

verification.acceptance: Chemistry limits are defined in procedures/specifications and are consistent with material compatibility guidance.

requirements.text: Surface finish requirements shall be specified for wetted surfaces and cladding to limit deposit adhesion and facilitate decontamination and inspection.

verification.acceptance: Surface finish requirements are specified and verified by inspection/records for relevant surfaces.

requirements.text: Material traceability shall be maintained from raw material through final installed component for all pressure boundary parts and weld filler metals.

verification.acceptance: Traceability records connect heat numbers/CMTRs to final parts and weld records without gaps.

requirements.text: Thermal insulation materials shall be compatible with operating temperatures and shall not promote external corrosion of carbon/low-alloy steel substrates (e.g., via chlorides or moisture retention).

verification.acceptance: Insulation material selection and specifications address corrosion-under-insulation risks and temperature compatibility.

requirements.text: Where dissimilar metal welds exist at nozzles or penetrations, material selection and mitigation features shall address susceptibility to PWSCC and thermal fatigue.

verification.acceptance: Dissimilar metal weld evaluation and mitigation approach are documented and incorporated into design/ISI plan.

requirements.text: Qualification requirements for cladding deposition or weld overlay (procedure qualification, dilution control, and heat input limits) shall be specified.

verification.acceptance: Cladding/overlay procedure qualifications exist and meet specified limits for composition and dilution.

requirements.text: The design shall specify allowable ranges for boron concentration {{primary_chemistry_boron_ppm_range}} and dissolved hydrogen {{dissolved_hydrogen_cckg_range}} (where applicable) consistent with materials and operability.

verification.acceptance: Chemistry ranges are specified and consistent with materials compatibility and pressure control considerations.

requirements.text: Galvanic compatibility between pressurizer internals, nozzles, and attached piping materials shall be evaluated for relevant temperature and chemistry conditions.

verification.acceptance: Galvanic corrosion evaluation demonstrates acceptable material pairings and identifies required mitigations if any.

requirements.text: Material properties used in design analyses shall be consistent with the specified heat treatment condition and expected service temperature range.

verification.acceptance: Design inputs for material properties match certified material condition and applicable temperature-dependent allowables.

requirements.text: A cleanliness level ({{cleanliness_level}}) shall be specified for fabrication and installation to prevent introduction of contaminants that could accelerate corrosion or deposit formation.

verification.acceptance: Cleanliness level is specified and verified by inspections and records throughout fabrication/installation.

requirements.text: Material controls shall address susceptibility to thermal aging embrittlement where applicable, including aging evaluations for long-term operation.

verification.acceptance: Aging evaluations and material controls demonstrate acceptable long-term properties for the design life.

requirement_sets.category: 6. Fabrication, welding, NDE, cleanliness, and code compliance documentation

requirements.text: Welding procedures for pressure boundary welds shall be qualified in accordance with ASME Section IX and applicable Section III requirements.

verification.acceptance: Qualified WPS/PQR packages exist and are approved for the applicable materials, thicknesses, and positions.

requirements.text: Welders and welding operators shall be qualified and maintained current for the qualified procedures used on pressurizer pressure boundary welds.

verification.acceptance: Welder qualification records demonstrate current qualification for applicable WPS and essential variables.

requirements.text: Nondestructive examination (NDE) methods, procedures, and personnel qualifications shall meet ASME Section V and Section III requirements for the code class.

verification.acceptance: NDE procedures and personnel certifications are documented and meet code requirements for the examinations performed.

requirements.text: Volumetric examinations of pressure boundary welds shall be performed using {{ndt_volumetric_method}} or equivalent qualified methods, with coverage and acceptance criteria per code.

verification.acceptance: Volumetric exam records demonstrate required coverage and acceptance criteria are met or repaired and re-examined.

requirements.text: Surface examinations of pressure boundary welds and cladding shall be performed using {{ndt_surface_method}} or equivalent qualified methods, per code requirements.

verification.acceptance: Surface exam records demonstrate required examination and acceptable indications per code.

requirements.text: Post-weld heat treatment (PWHT) shall be performed where required (pwht_required={{pwht_required}}) at {{post_weld_heat_treat_temp}} °C ± tolerance, with controlled heating/cooling rates.

verification.acceptance: PWHT charts/records demonstrate compliance with specified temperature/time and controlled rates for applicable welds.

requirements.text: Cladding deposition and any weld overlay shall be performed with qualified procedures controlling dilution, heat input, and post-process examinations.

verification.acceptance: Cladding/overlay procedures are qualified; examination records demonstrate acceptable thickness, bonding, and defect limits.

requirements.text: Dimensional inspections shall verify critical dimensions, nozzle locations, penetration alignments, and internal component clearances prior to shipment.

verification.acceptance: Dimensional inspection reports demonstrate conformance to drawings/tolerances for critical features.

requirements.text: Cleanliness controls shall be implemented during fabrication and assembly to meet the specified cleanliness_level {{cleanliness_level}}, including foreign material controls and final cleaning verification.

verification.acceptance: Cleanliness/FME records demonstrate compliance; final inspection verifies no unacceptable debris or residues remain.

requirements.text: Material identification and traceability (heat numbers, CMTRs, and part marking) shall be maintained throughout fabrication and documented in the data package.

verification.acceptance: Traceability documentation links materials and parts to CMTRs and final assemblies without gaps.

requirements.text: Nonconformances identified during fabrication or inspection shall be documented, dispositioned, and verified (repair, accept-as-is, or reject) under the QA program.

verification.acceptance: NCR process is implemented; dispositions are approved and re-inspection/testing confirms acceptance.

requirements.text: A certified ASME data report (e.g., N-Stamp data report) shall be provided with the pressurizer, including design, materials, examinations, and tests.

verification.acceptance: ASME data report is complete, signed, and included in turnover documentation.

requirements.text: Protective measures shall be applied to prevent damage to cladding, nozzle surfaces, and penetrations during handling and shipment, including end caps and protective covers.

verification.acceptance: Shipping/handling plan and inspections demonstrate surfaces are protected and no damage is present at receipt.

requirements.text: Shipping preservation shall maintain internal dryness/cleanliness and prevent corrosion for the specified shipping and storage duration.

verification.acceptance: Preservation records and receiving inspections demonstrate preservation requirements were met and no corrosion/contamination occurred.

requirements.text: Heater penetrations and electrical feedthrough seals shall be leak-tested and inspected as part of fabrication acceptance testing.

verification.acceptance: Penetration leak test results meet acceptance criteria; visual inspections confirm seal integrity.

requirements.text: Factory pressure testing (hydrostatic or pneumatic as allowed) shall be performed per code with documented hold times and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Factory test reports demonstrate required pressure/hold time and no unacceptable leakage or deformation.

requirements.text: Final internal inspection shall verify absence of foreign material, acceptable surface condition, and correct installation of internals prior to closure/shipment.

verification.acceptance: Final internal inspection checklist is complete and signed; discrepancies are corrected and reverified.

requirements.text: All permanent markings (nameplate, code stamp, heat numbers where required, and orientation markings) shall be legible and consistent with documentation.

verification.acceptance: Markings are verified against documentation and remain legible after fabrication/testing.

requirements.text: Documentation shall include weld maps, NDE reports, PWHT records, cladding records, dimensional inspection, and test reports sufficient for turnover and future ISI planning.

verification.acceptance: Data package contains required records and is cross-referenced; turnover checklist is complete.

requirements.text: Instrument and heater components procured as commercial-grade items shall be dedicated (where required) with defined critical characteristics, acceptance methods, and records.

verification.acceptance: Dedication plan and results demonstrate critical characteristics are verified and documented.

requirements.text: NDE equipment shall be calibrated and controlled, and calibration records shall be maintained for instruments used on pressurizer examinations.

verification.acceptance: Records demonstrate the requirement is implemented and controlled.

requirements.text: Digital NDE data (where used) shall be archived in a retrievable format to support future comparisons and ISI trending.

verification.acceptance: Records demonstrate the requirement is implemented and controlled.

requirements.text: Repair welds shall be re-examined using the same or superior NDE methods and acceptance criteria as the original weld examinations.

verification.acceptance: Records demonstrate the requirement is implemented and controlled.

requirements.text: A cleanliness verification test (e.g., wipe test or flush particulate count as applicable) shall be performed prior to turnover when nuclear cleanliness is specified.

verification.acceptance: Records demonstrate the requirement is implemented and controlled.

requirements.text: Procurement specifications shall require sub-tier supplier control and flowdown of applicable QA, documentation, and inspection hold points.

verification.acceptance: Records demonstrate the requirement is implemented and controlled.

requirement_sets.category: 7. Pressure control features: heaters, spray, venting, and inventory management

requirements.text: Pressurizer heaters shall be sized and configured to provide total installed power {{heater_power_total}} MW with redundancy such that loss of a single heater group does not prevent maintaining pressure within operating limits.

verification.acceptance: Redundancy and capacity analysis plus functional tests demonstrate pressure control is maintained with one group out of service.

requirements.text: Heaters shall be arranged into {{heater_group_count}} independently controllable groups with lead/lag or staged control (heater_zone_control={{heater_zone_control}}) to support stable pressure control.

verification.acceptance: Control design and commissioning test demonstrate independent group control and stable staged response.

requirements.text: Heater electrical circuits shall include overcurrent and overtemperature protection, including heater overtemperature trip at {{heater_overtemp_trip}} °C where specified.

verification.acceptance: Protection devices and setpoints are installed and tested; heater circuits trip within specified limits.

requirements.text: Ground-fault protection for heater circuits shall be provided and tested (heater_ground_fault_protection={{heater_ground_fault_protection}}).

verification.acceptance: Ground-fault detection and protective actions are verified by test; documentation shows compliance.

requirements.text: Heater current monitoring shall be provided (heater_current_monitoring={{heater_current_monitoring}}) to detect failed/shorted heaters and support maintenance diagnostics.

verification.acceptance: Monitoring design provides group or element current indication with alarm/diagnostic capability; verified by test.

requirements.text: Heater penetrations and seals shall be designed to maintain pressure boundary integrity under thermal cycles and vibration, and to be replaceable without vessel replacement.

verification.acceptance: Penetration design evaluation and maintenance plan demonstrate integrity and replaceability.

requirements.text: If heater bundles are removable (heater_bundle_removable=true), the design shall provide access and tooling features to remove/replace bundles within outage constraints without disturbing pressure boundary welds.

verification.acceptance: Maintenance procedure and mockup/demonstration (or equivalent) shows heater bundle replacement is feasible within access constraints.

requirements.text: Spare heater bundle quantity shall be specified (spare_heater_bundle_count≥{{spare_heater_bundle_count}}) consistent with availability targets and procurement lead times.

verification.acceptance: Spare parts plan defines required spares and procurement strategy; spares are procured or planned.

requirements.text: If a spray system is provided, spray nozzles ({{spray_nozzle_count}}) shall provide adequate distribution and droplet characteristics (spray_nozzle_type={{spray_nozzle_type}}) to avoid thermal shock and to promote mixing.

verification.acceptance: Spray nozzle design and mixing/thermal shock evaluation demonstrate acceptable temperature gradients and mixing performance.

requirements.text: Spray control valve sizing (spray_control_valve_cv={{spray_control_valve_cv}}) and actuation (spray_valve_actuation={{spray_valve_actuation}}) shall support required response time {{spray_response_time}} s and controllability at low flows.

verification.acceptance: Valve sizing and dynamic response tests demonstrate required response time and stable control across operating range.

requirements.text: Spray valve fail position (spray_valve_fail_position={{spray_valve_fail_position}}) and interlocks (spray_interlocks_required={{spray_interlocks_required}}) shall be defined to prevent adverse transients on loss of power or instrument air.

verification.acceptance: Fail position and interlocks are documented and verified to avoid unsafe or destabilizing behavior.

requirements.text: A check valve or anti-siphon feature shall be provided in the spray line where needed (spray_line_check_valve_present={{spray_line_check_valve_present}}) to prevent reverse flow or siphoning.

verification.acceptance: Design includes required check/anti-siphon features; functional testing verifies intended flow direction control.

requirements.text: Spray water source (spray_water_source={{spray_water_source}}) shall meet chemistry and temperature requirements (spray_water_temp={{spray_water_temp}} °C) to prevent adverse chemistry transients and thermal shock.

verification.acceptance: Source definition and chemistry/thermal evaluations demonstrate compatibility with pressurizer materials and transient limits.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide vent and drain paths that support noncondensable gas control and allow controlled formation and maintenance of the steam space.

verification.acceptance: Vent/drain design and startup testing demonstrate effective gas control and steam space management.

requirements.text: Venting operations shall be designed to route to an appropriate discharge handling system and prevent uncontrolled releases.

verification.acceptance: Vent routing and procedures prevent uncontrolled releases; discharge handling capacity and controls are defined.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide level measurement and control provisions that maintain heater coverage and avoid heater uncovering during expected transients.

verification.acceptance: Level control analysis and functional testing demonstrate heater coverage is maintained for expected conditions.

requirements.text: Heater interlocks (heater_interlocks_required={{heater_interlocks_required}}) shall prevent energizing heaters under conditions that would damage heaters or violate operating limits (e.g., low level, abnormal temperatures).

verification.acceptance: Interlock logic is defined and verified by test to prevent energization under prohibited conditions.

requirements.text: The pressurizer control strategy shall include bumpless transfer and manual override provisions to support safe operation during instrument/channel failures.

verification.acceptance: Control system supports bumpless transfer and manual control; functionality is verified during commissioning tests.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions to avoid heater hot spots caused by localized boiling or deposit buildup, including monitoring and chemistry controls.

verification.acceptance: Design and operating controls reduce hot spot risk; monitoring/chemistry requirements are documented.

requirements.text: Heater power supply equipment (breakers, transformers, SCRs/thyristor controllers if used) shall be rated for duty cycle and environmental/seismic conditions for its installation location.

verification.acceptance: Equipment ratings and qualification demonstrate capability under specified duty and environment/seismic conditions.

requirements.text: Spray system hydraulic design shall prevent droplet impingement on vessel wall regions susceptible to thermal fatigue, or shall include protective features to mitigate impingement effects.

verification.acceptance: Thermal fatigue evaluation demonstrates acceptable wall stresses/usage under spray transients; protective features are documented.

requirements.text: Heater and spray controls shall be coordinated with charging/letdown control to avoid competing control actions and limit cycling that increases fatigue usage.

verification.acceptance: Control coordination analysis and test demonstrate limited cycling and stable coordinated response.

requirements.text: Where pressurizer is integral, heater/spray features (if provided) shall be designed for module maintainability and replacement consistent with integral design constraints.

verification.acceptance: Integral design maintainability evaluation demonstrates heater/spray component serviceability within module constraints.

requirements.text: Pressurizer inventory management logic shall prevent exceeding normal level limits during anticipated operational occurrences (e.g., charging transients) while maintaining pressure control objectives.

verification.acceptance: Inventory control analysis and commissioning tests demonstrate level limits are maintained without unacceptable pressure deviations.

requirements.text: A procedure and design provision shall exist to safely de-energize and isolate heater circuits for maintenance without introducing pressure boundary leakage risk.

verification.acceptance: Isolation and LOTO provisions are defined; maintenance can be performed without affecting pressure boundary integrity.

requirement_sets.category: 8. Overpressure protection and relief system interfaces

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall interface with overpressure protection devices (safety valves and/or PORVs) sized to prevent exceeding design pressure {{design_pressure}} MPa during limiting overpressure events.

verification.acceptance: Relief capacity analysis demonstrates peak pressure remains within allowable limits for limiting events.

requirements.text: Pressurizer safety valves (count {{safety_valve_count}}) shall have setpoint {{safety_valve_setpoint}} MPa and capacity ≥ {{safety_valve_capacity}} kg/s per valve (or equivalent) as specified.

verification.acceptance: Safety valve specifications and test certificates demonstrate setpoint and capacity requirements are met.

requirements.text: Safety valve blowdown ({{safety_valve_blowdown_percent}}%) shall be specified and verified to ensure stable reseat behavior without excessive cycling.

verification.acceptance: Vendor test data and/or analysis demonstrates blowdown within specified range and acceptable cycling behavior.

requirements.text: Power-operated relief valves (PORVs) (count {{porv_count}}) shall have setpoint {{porv_setpoint}} MPa, capacity ≥ {{porv_capacity}} kg/s, and defined fail position (porv_fail_position={{porv_fail_position}}).

verification.acceptance: PORV specifications and functional tests demonstrate setpoints, capacity, and fail-safe behavior.

requirements.text: If PORV block valves are provided (porv_block_valve_present=true), their controls and interlocks shall prevent inadvertent isolation of required overpressure protection functions.

verification.acceptance: Interlocks/administrative controls prevent unsafe isolation; verification demonstrates compliance.

requirements.text: Relief discharge piping and downstream handling components shall be designed for expected discharge loads, thermal shocks, and two-phase flow effects during relief events.

verification.acceptance: Discharge system analysis demonstrates structural adequacy for thermal/dynamic loads and two-phase flow regimes.

requirements.text: Relief discharge backpressure shall be limited to ≤ {{relief_discharge_backpressure_limit}} MPa to maintain relief device performance and stability.

verification.acceptance: Backpressure analysis/testing demonstrates backpressure remains within specified limit during relief events.

requirements.text: If a quench/sparger device is used (relief_line_quench_device_present={{relief_line_quench_device_present}}), it shall be designed to limit thermal shock, vibration, and noise to acceptable levels.

verification.acceptance: Design evaluation demonstrates acceptable thermal/vibration/noise performance; installation is verified by inspection.

requirements.text: Relief discharge tank or header design pressure {{discharge_tank_design_pressure}} MPa and temperature {{discharge_tank_design_temperature}} °C shall be specified and verified consistent with discharge transients.

verification.acceptance: Design documentation demonstrates discharge handling equipment is rated for expected conditions and transients.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide instrumentation and alarms for relief device actuation and status indication to support operator awareness and event response.

verification.acceptance: Status/actuation indications and alarms are implemented and verified during commissioning tests.

requirements.text: Relief devices and discharge system shall be accessible for periodic testing and maintenance with appropriate isolation and depressurization provisions.

verification.acceptance: Access and isolation provisions support testing/maintenance without compromising safety or pressure boundary integrity.

requirements.text: Relief event analyses shall account for potential water carryover and two-phase discharge conditions to bound loads and discharge system performance.

verification.acceptance: Relief transient analysis bounds carryover and two-phase effects; discharge system design is adequate for bounding conditions.

requirements.text: The pressurizer relief path shall include provisions to prevent uncontrolled releases to the environment and to route discharges to controlled systems.

verification.acceptance: Relief discharge routing is controlled and consistent with plant design basis; no uncontrolled release pathways exist.

requirements.text: Functional testing of relief device actuation logic and setpoints shall be performed during commissioning and periodically per plant programs.

verification.acceptance: Test procedures and results demonstrate actuation logic and setpoints are within acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Overpressure protection design shall include considerations for common-cause failures (e.g., loss of power, loss of air) and provide appropriate redundancy/diversity.

verification.acceptance: Failure modes evaluation demonstrates overpressure protection remains available for credible common-cause failures.

requirements.text: Relief system interfaces shall minimize the potential for water hammer, including appropriate line slopes, venting, and operating procedures.

verification.acceptance: Water hammer assessment demonstrates controls and design features reduce risk to acceptable levels.

requirements.text: Relief device installation shall include tamper-resistant setpoint controls and configuration control to prevent unauthorized adjustment.

verification.acceptance: Physical and administrative controls prevent unauthorized setpoint changes; changes are tracked under configuration management.

requirements.text: Relief device qualification documentation shall include capacity certification, setpoint testing, and environmental/seismic qualification as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Qualification documents demonstrate compliance for capacity, setpoint, and required environmental/seismic conditions.

requirement_sets.category: 9. Instrumentation, controls, monitoring, and setpoint management

requirements.text: Pressurizer pressure measurement shall be provided with redundancy (instrument_channel_redundancy={{instrument_channel_redundancy}}) and accuracy ≤ {{pressure_sensor_accuracy}} %span to support control and protection functions.

verification.acceptance: Instrument specifications, calibration records, and test results demonstrate redundancy and accuracy requirements are met.

requirements.text: Pressurizer level measurement shall be provided with redundancy and accuracy ≤ {{level_sensor_accuracy}} %span across the level_control_range_percent {{level_control_range_percent}}%.

verification.acceptance: Level measurement range and accuracy are verified by calibration and functional testing.

requirements.text: Pressurizer temperature measurements (liquid and steam space as applicable) shall be provided with accuracy ≤ {{temperature_sensor_accuracy}} °C to support thermal-hydraulic and protection functions.

verification.acceptance: Sensor specifications and calibration demonstrate accuracy requirements across expected temperature range.

requirements.text: Control system interfaces (control_system_interface={{control_system_interface}}) shall be defined for pressurizer pressure and level control, including signal lists, setpoints, and failure responses.

verification.acceptance: Interface control documentation defines all required signals, setpoints, and failure responses.

requirements.text: Safety-related instrumentation and controls associated with pressurizer functions shall meet applicable safety system criteria, including independence, redundancy, and testability.

verification.acceptance: I&C architecture demonstrates independence/redundancy; surveillance test provisions exist and are documented.

requirements.text: Instrumentation important to safety installed in harsh environments (harsh_environment={{harsh_environment}}) shall be environmentally qualified per 10 CFR 50.49 and IEEE 323.

verification.acceptance: EQ documentation demonstrates qualification for temperature {{env_temp_high}}, humidity {{env_humidity_high}}, and radiation {{env_radiation_total}} as applicable.

requirements.text: Pressurizer I&C equipment required to function during/after seismic events shall be seismically qualified per IEEE 344 and the seismic category classification.

verification.acceptance: Seismic qualification documentation demonstrates compliance for the required SSE spectra and mounting configurations.

requirements.text: Setpoint management shall control pressurizer protection and control setpoints (high/low pressure trips, relief setpoints) with configuration control and periodic verification.

verification.acceptance: Setpoint calculations, approvals, and periodic verification records exist under configuration control.

requirements.text: Pressurizer heater control shall include permissives and interlocks (heater_interlocks_required={{heater_interlocks_required}}) and status indication to the control room.

verification.acceptance: Permissives/interlocks and indications are implemented and verified by functional testing.

requirements.text: Pressurizer spray control shall include permissives and interlocks (spray_interlocks_required={{spray_interlocks_required}}) and status indication to the control room.

verification.acceptance: Spray permissives/interlocks and indications are implemented and verified by functional testing.

requirements.text: Alarm setpoints for abnormal pressurizer conditions (high pressure, low pressure, high level, low level, heater failure, spray failure) shall be defined and validated.

verification.acceptance: Alarm setpoints are documented and validated against operating limits and control/protection logic; verified by test where practical.

requirements.text: The control system shall provide trending and historian data for key pressurizer parameters (pressure, level, heater power, spray flow, relief events) to support diagnostics and event response.

verification.acceptance: Historian/trending points are configured and verified; data retention supports event reconstruction needs.

requirements.text: Control logic shall include rate limiting or filtering where necessary to prevent control-induced cycling that increases fatigue usage.

verification.acceptance: Control stability analysis demonstrates rate limits/filtering prevent undue cycling while maintaining response requirements.

requirements.text: Sensor drift and calibration intervals shall be defined based on required accuracy and environmental conditions, with procedures for as-found/as-left data capture.

verification.acceptance: Calibration program defines intervals, acceptance limits, and as-found/as-left record requirements.

requirements.text: Redundant channels shall be powered from appropriate power sources and maintain independence to the extent required by the safety classification.

verification.acceptance: Power and independence evaluation demonstrates required separation and independence for safety-related channels.

requirements.text: Pressurizer I&C shall include self-diagnostics and failure annunciation to support timely detection of failed sensors, stuck valves, or heater group failures.

verification.acceptance: Diagnostics and annunciation are verified through functional test scenarios or simulation.

requirements.text: Control software/firmware affecting pressurizer safety functions shall be developed, verified, and controlled under the plant software QA program.

verification.acceptance: Software lifecycle artifacts (requirements, V&V, version control, change history) are available per QA program.

requirements.text: Cybersecurity controls for pressurizer I&C assets (cyber_security_zone={{cyber_security_zone}}) shall be implemented consistent with the plant cybersecurity program.

verification.acceptance: Cyber controls appropriate to zone are implemented and verified (access control, logging, change control).

requirements.text: Instrument uncertainty analyses shall be performed for safety-significant setpoints to ensure adequate margins between setpoints and safety limits.

verification.acceptance: Uncertainty analysis demonstrates margins are maintained after accounting for accuracy, drift, and response time.

requirements.text: Pressurizer pressure, level, and temperature sensors shall have response times adequate to support control stability and protection functions.

verification.acceptance: Response time requirements are specified and verified by test or vendor data; control/protection analyses confirm adequacy.

requirements.text: A periodic channel functional test strategy shall be defined to verify sensors, logic, and output devices, including simulated signal injection where appropriate.

verification.acceptance: Surveillance test procedures exist and demonstrate the ability to verify channel functionality without compromising safety.

requirements.text: Where pressurizer signals are used by the reactor protection system (rps_actuation_setpoints_defined={{rps_actuation_setpoints_defined}}), the interfaces shall meet independence and reliability requirements for safety systems.

verification.acceptance: RPS interface analysis demonstrates required independence and reliability; setpoints are defined and controlled.

requirements.text: Spare instrumentation (spare_instrument_count≥{{spare_instrument_count}}) and critical maintenance tools shall be identified to support plant availability targets.

verification.acceptance: Spare parts list identifies critical instruments and tools; procurement/stocking strategy is documented.

requirements.text: Instrumentation penetrations classified as Class 1E (electrical_penetration_eq_class={{electrical_penetration_eq_class}}) shall meet applicable EQ and safety qualification requirements.

verification.acceptance: Qualification documentation demonstrates compliance for Class 1E penetrations under required environmental and seismic conditions.

requirements.text: Pressurizer instrumentation and control wiring and electronics shall be designed to mitigate EMI/RFI and grounding issues that could compromise measurement accuracy or control stability.

verification.acceptance: EMI/RFI controls (cable routing, shielding, grounding, separation) are defined and verified against design criteria.

requirement_sets.category: 10. Transient, fatigue, fracture, and aging management

requirements.text: A fatigue analysis shall be performed for the pressurizer using the defined design transients and cycles (design_cycles={{design_cycles}}) consistent with the code-of-record and licensing basis.

verification.acceptance: Fatigue analysis demonstrates cumulative usage factors within allowable limits for all evaluated locations.

requirements.text: The fatigue usage factor limit shall not exceed {{fatigue_usage_factor_limit}} (fraction) for evaluated locations, unless otherwise justified and approved per the licensing basis.

verification.acceptance: Reported cumulative usage factors meet specified limit or deviations are justified and approved.

requirements.text: Fatigue evaluations shall explicitly address surge line and spray nozzle thermal transients, including stratification and mixing phenomena where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Analyses include bounding thermal gradients/stratification effects and demonstrate acceptable fatigue margins.

requirements.text: Environmentally-assisted fatigue (EAF) considerations shall be evaluated for applicable materials and locations per applicable guidance and licensing commitments.

verification.acceptance: EAF evaluation demonstrates compliance with required factors or corrective actions are defined.

requirements.text: Pressurizer fracture mechanics evaluations shall consider postulated flaws, material toughness, and loading for relevant service levels, including upset and emergency conditions.

verification.acceptance: Fracture evaluations demonstrate adequate margins against unstable fracture for postulated flaws and loads.

requirements.text: A pressure-temperature (P-T) limits program shall be established and maintained for the pressurizer and associated pressure boundary to prevent brittle fracture during heatup/cooldown.

verification.acceptance: P-T curves and operating procedures exist, are controlled, and are supported by material toughness and analysis basis.

requirements.text: Thermal shock analyses shall be performed for spray and relief events that introduce rapid temperature changes, with design features or operating limits to maintain acceptable stresses.

verification.acceptance: Thermal shock evaluations demonstrate stresses within allowable limits and fatigue usage within limits for spray/relief events.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions to monitor or infer key fatigue drivers (e.g., number of heatup/cooldown cycles, spray actuations, relief events) to support fatigue management.

verification.acceptance: Monitoring strategy is defined; data sources and calculations support fatigue management reporting.

requirements.text: Aging management evaluations shall address thermal aging embrittlement, corrosion/erosion, and stress corrosion cracking for relevant materials and environments.

verification.acceptance: Aging mechanisms and mitigations are documented; inspection/monitoring plan supports early detection and corrective actions.

requirements.text: Heater penetration regions shall be evaluated for thermal fatigue and stress concentration due to cyclic heating and localized boiling phenomena.

verification.acceptance: Penetration fatigue analyses demonstrate acceptable usage factors and identify monitoring or design mitigations if needed.

requirements.text: Surge line nozzle region shall be evaluated for thermal stratification-induced fatigue, including bounding hot/cold layer gradients and mixing transients.

verification.acceptance: Stratification fatigue evaluation demonstrates acceptable margins; operating limits or design features mitigate adverse gradients.

requirements.text: Where dissimilar metal welds are present, aging management shall address PWSCC susceptibility and include inspection or mitigation strategies.

verification.acceptance: Inspection/mitigation strategy is defined and aligned with degradation susceptibility and plant programs.

requirements.text: Thermal cycling of cladding and liner (if present) shall be evaluated for potential cracking or delamination over design life.

verification.acceptance: Thermal cycling evaluation demonstrates cladding/liner integrity for the defined cycles and transients.

requirements.text: Operational limits shall be specified to avoid extended operation with steam space noncondensables at levels that could degrade pressure control or accelerate corrosion.

verification.acceptance: Operational limits and surveillance actions are defined and consistent with chemistry and operability assumptions.

requirements.text: The design shall include allowances for inspection growth and repair (e.g., cladding repairs, weld overlays) consistent with long-term operation considerations.

verification.acceptance: Repair/inspection allowances are documented; design supports feasible repairs without compromising integrity.

requirements.text: Fatigue evaluations shall consider the effect of control system behavior (e.g., cycling frequency) and ensure control tuning does not drive excessive cycling.

verification.acceptance: Control tuning and fatigue evaluation demonstrate cycling frequency is bounded and acceptable for fatigue usage assumptions.

requirements.text: Thermal sleeves, spray nozzles, and internal attachments shall be evaluated for wear/fretting due to differential movement and flow-induced vibration.

verification.acceptance: Wear/fretting evaluation demonstrates acceptable margins; inspection or design mitigations are specified if needed.

requirements.text: A flaw evaluation approach for detected indications (including disposition thresholds and repair criteria) shall be defined consistent with ASME Section XI methods.

verification.acceptance: Flaw evaluation procedures and acceptance criteria are defined and aligned with Section XI methodology and licensing basis.

requirements.text: For integral pressurizer designs, aging management shall address module-specific thermal gradients and accessibility constraints for inspections and repairs.

verification.acceptance: Integral design aging management plan identifies module-specific mechanisms and feasible inspection/repair strategies.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions to support periodic assessment of insulation condition to mitigate corrosion-under-insulation and heat loss changes over time.

verification.acceptance: Inspection provisions and procedures exist; insulation can be inspected/maintained as part of plant programs.

requirements.text: Design transients shall include relief valve lift events and subsequent thermal shocks to discharge nozzles and adjacent piping regions.

verification.acceptance: Transient list and evaluations include relief events and demonstrate acceptable stress/fatigue margins.

requirements.text: Pressurizer setpoint changes and operating mode transitions (startup, shutdown, hot standby) shall be evaluated for their impact on fatigue usage and structural margins.

verification.acceptance: Evaluations demonstrate mode transitions do not exceed fatigue assumptions and remain within structural limits.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall support collection of operating experience data needed to validate or update fatigue and aging assumptions (e.g., temperature gradients, cycle counts).

verification.acceptance: Data collection requirements and implementation exist; data supports periodic revalidation activities.

requirements.text: A risk-informed evaluation may be used to prioritize inspection and monitoring locations based on fatigue/aging susceptibility and consequence, consistent with plant programs.

verification.acceptance: Risk-informed prioritization method and results are documented and applied to inspection/monitoring scope.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions for periodic verification of P-T limits and material toughness inputs as surveillance data becomes available (where applicable).

verification.acceptance: Program defines periodic update/verification triggers and incorporates surveillance data as applicable.

requirement_sets.category: 11. Seismic, dynamic loads, and support/anchorage design

requirements.text: If classified Seismic Category I, the pressurizer, supports, and attached appurtenances shall be designed to remain functional and maintain pressure boundary integrity under SSE loading.

verification.acceptance: Seismic analyses demonstrate structural integrity and required functional capability under SSE for Category I classification.

requirements.text: Seismic input spectra and in-structure response spectra used for pressurizer design shall be defined and controlled as design inputs.

verification.acceptance: Seismic input definitions are documented and traceable to plant seismic design basis; changes are controlled.

requirements.text: Support anchorage (support_type={{support_type}}) and anchor bolts (support_anchor_bolt_size={{support_anchor_bolt_size}}) shall be designed for combined loads including seismic, deadweight, and thermal effects.

verification.acceptance: Anchorage calculations demonstrate capacity and acceptable margins for combined load cases.

requirements.text: Rattle space and clearances shall be provided to prevent impact with adjacent structures under seismic displacements where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Seismic displacement analysis and layout confirm adequate clearances and rattle space.

requirements.text: Dynamic loads from relief valve discharge, steam/water hammer, and rapid spray transients shall be evaluated for effects on nozzles, supports, and attached piping.

verification.acceptance: Dynamic load evaluations demonstrate acceptable stresses and support/anchorage margins.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall be evaluated for interaction with piping restraint systems (snubbers, supports) and bounding nozzle loads under seismic and transient conditions.

verification.acceptance: Interface analysis demonstrates compatibility between vessel and piping restraints and that nozzle loads are bounded.

requirements.text: Qualification of mechanical equipment required for pressurizer functionality during/after seismic events shall be consistent with applicable guidance (e.g., RG 1.100) and IEEE 344 as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Qualification documentation demonstrates compliance with required seismic qualification approach and mounting configuration.

requirements.text: Supports shall accommodate thermal expansion without binding, including sliding surfaces or flexures where necessary, while maintaining seismic restraint capability.

verification.acceptance: Thermal expansion evaluation and design review confirm adequate sliding/clearance features and seismic restraint behavior.

requirements.text: Potential resonance of the pressurizer/support system shall be evaluated against dominant seismic frequencies and flow-induced excitation where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Dynamic analysis demonstrates acceptable separation from dominant excitation frequencies or adequate damping.

requirements.text: Pressurizer internals and attachments shall be seismically restrained to prevent damage, loosening, or interference with pressure control functions.

verification.acceptance: Internal restraint design and evaluations demonstrate acceptable performance under seismic loads.

requirements.text: Seismic evaluation shall include consideration of sloshing effects in the pressurizer liquid volume and resulting loads on internals and nozzles where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Sloshing analysis demonstrates loads are bounded and design is adequate.

requirements.text: Qualification of electrical penetrations and heater power circuits for seismic loads shall include anchorage, cable supports, and equipment mounting for the SSE environment.

verification.acceptance: Seismic qualification evidence covers mounting, anchorage, and cable support for required equipment.

requirements.text: Seismic-induced differential displacements between the pressurizer and adjacent structures shall be evaluated to prevent overstress of piping and supports.

verification.acceptance: Differential displacement evaluation demonstrates piping/support designs accommodate relative movement without overstress.

requirements.text: Design shall consider flooding or pool effects (if applicable to plant layout) on pressurizer support loads and buoyancy, including for integral modules.

verification.acceptance: Flooding/buoyancy evaluation demonstrates supports and restraints remain adequate for applicable scenarios.

requirements.text: Inspection and acceptance criteria for as-built anchorage and support installation shall be defined, including torque/tension verification and as-built surveys.

verification.acceptance: As-built support/anchorage inspections and torque/tension verifications meet acceptance criteria and are documented.

requirements.text: Where snubbers are used in pressurizer support/piping systems, they shall be selected, installed, and maintained to provide required dynamic restraint performance.

verification.acceptance: Snubber specifications and maintenance/testing program demonstrate required performance.

requirements.text: Load combinations for seismic evaluation shall include concurrent thermal and pressure loads as required by code and plant design basis.
