verification.acceptance: Seismic load combinations used in analyses match code and design basis requirements and demonstrate acceptable margins.

requirements.text: For integral pressurizer designs, transport and installation dynamic loads shall be combined with seismic qualification assumptions to ensure no unaccounted damage accumulates.

verification.acceptance: Transport/installation load evaluation demonstrates no unacceptable cumulative damage or margin loss relative to seismic qualification assumptions.

requirement_sets.category: 12. Environmental qualification, insulation, and external hazards

requirements.text: Pressurizer electrical equipment important to safety installed in harsh environments shall be environmentally qualified for temperature, humidity, radiation, and pressure effects consistent with 10 CFR 50.49 and IEEE 323.

verification.acceptance: EQ documentation demonstrates qualification for the specified environment and service conditions for required mission times.

requirements.text: Environmental conditions for pressurizer area (env_temp_high={{env_temp_high}} °C, env_humidity_high={{env_humidity_high}}%RH, radiation {{env_radiation_total}} Gy) shall be defined and used for equipment qualification.

verification.acceptance: Environmental envelopes are documented and used consistently in qualification and equipment selection.

requirements.text: Thermal insulation shall be designed to limit external surface temperatures to ≤ {{surface_temp_limit}} °C to support personnel protection and to control heat loss.

verification.acceptance: Insulation calculations and installation inspections demonstrate surface temperature limit and heat loss requirements are met.

requirements.text: Insulation thickness {{insulation_thickness_mm}} mm and type {{insulation_type}} shall be specified for pressurizer shell and nozzles where required.

verification.acceptance: Insulation design documents specify thickness and type; installation verification confirms conformance.

requirements.text: Insulation shall be removable in designated areas to support ISI and maintenance (insulation_removable_for_isi={{insulation_removable_for_isi}}) without damaging cladding or surface coatings.

verification.acceptance: Removable insulation features are provided and demonstrated; removal does not damage surfaces or compromise integrity.

requirements.text: Fire hazards in the pressurizer area (including heater power equipment and insulation) shall be evaluated and mitigations implemented consistent with plant fire protection design basis.

verification.acceptance: Fire hazard analysis and design features/procedures demonstrate fire risks are addressed and mitigated.

requirements.text: Protection from flooding and spray exposure shall be provided for pressurizer electrical equipment and penetrations as applicable to plant layout and design basis events.

verification.acceptance: Flooding/spray protection evaluation demonstrates adequate protection or qualification for exposure.

requirements.text: The pressurizer and associated equipment shall be protected from impacts/missiles and pipe whip effects consistent with plant high-energy line break analyses where applicable.

verification.acceptance: HELB/pipe whip analysis demonstrates adequate protection, separation, or restraints.

requirements.text: Noise and vibration from relief events and heater power equipment shall be evaluated for personnel exposure and equipment integrity, with mitigations as required.

verification.acceptance: Noise/vibration evaluation demonstrates compliance with plant limits and acceptable equipment response; mitigations implemented as needed.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions to prevent condensation and moisture accumulation in electrical enclosures and penetrations (e.g., heaters, sensors), consistent with environmental conditions.

verification.acceptance: Design features (sealing, heaters, drainage, ventilation) prevent moisture-related degradation; verified by inspection.

requirements.text: Qualification of insulation materials shall consider radiation and temperature aging where insulation is located in harsh environments.

verification.acceptance: Insulation material qualifications address aging for the defined environment and service life or maintenance replacement intervals are defined.

requirements.text: External corrosion protection (coatings/paint systems) for non-wetted external surfaces shall be specified consistent with the plant environment and insulation system.

verification.acceptance: Coating specifications and inspections demonstrate proper application and compatibility with insulation system and environment.

requirements.text: Pressurizer area ventilation and heat removal assumptions used to support equipment qualification and operability shall be documented and controlled.

verification.acceptance: Ventilation/heat removal assumptions are documented and traceable to analyses and equipment qualification envelopes.

requirements.text: Where applicable, hydrogen control considerations in the pressurizer area shall be addressed to prevent accumulation and to maintain safe operating conditions.

verification.acceptance: Hydrogen control evaluation demonstrates safe concentrations and appropriate monitoring/ventilation provisions.

requirements.text: The pressurizer design shall include labeling and barriers for hot surfaces and electrical hazards (heaters/power panels) to support personnel safety.

verification.acceptance: Labels/barriers meet plant safety criteria and are present and verified by inspection.

requirements.text: A preoperational test program shall include pressurizer functional testing consistent with Regulatory Guide 1.68, including pressure control, level control, and relief interface verification.

verification.acceptance: Preoperational test procedures and results demonstrate required pressurizer functions and acceptance criteria are met.

requirements.text: Hydrostatic testing of the pressurizer pressure boundary shall be performed per ASME Section III at the required test pressure (≥ {{hydrotest_pressure}} MPa) with hold time and acceptance criteria per code.

verification.acceptance: Hydrotest results demonstrate no unacceptable leakage or deformation; required inspections and documentation are complete.

requirements.text: Leak testing of penetrations, closures, and heater feedthroughs shall be performed with documented acceptance criteria, including leak rate ≤ {{leak_rate_limit}} kg/h where specified.

verification.acceptance: Leak test results meet specified leak rate and acceptance criteria; anomalies are corrected and retested.

requirements.text: Functional testing shall demonstrate heater group sequencing, power modulation, and protection trips (overtemp, ground fault) operate as designed.

verification.acceptance: Test results demonstrate heater control functions and protective trips operate correctly and within setpoint tolerances.

requirements.text: If spray system is provided, functional testing shall demonstrate spray valve response time ≤ {{spray_response_time}} s and controllability over expected flow range.

verification.acceptance: Spray functional tests demonstrate response time, stable control, and flow range capability.

requirements.text: Instrumentation calibrations shall be performed and documented for pressure, level, and temperature sensors prior to initial criticality and periodically thereafter.

verification.acceptance: Calibration records demonstrate as-left values within tolerance and as-found/as-left data is retained.

requirements.text: Control system logic associated with pressurizer functions shall be verified by integrated testing, including failure simulations and alarm validation.

verification.acceptance: Integrated tests demonstrate logic correctness, failure behavior, and alarm response consistent with requirements.

requirements.text: Relief device setpoints and functional actuation shall be verified by test or certified vendor test data prior to service and periodically as required by plant programs.

verification.acceptance: Setpoint verification records demonstrate compliance; periodic surveillance is established and tracked.

requirements.text: A pressurizer heat loss verification shall be performed (by calculation and, where practical, measurement) to confirm compliance with {{heat_loss_max}} kW limit.

verification.acceptance: Heat loss verification demonstrates compliance with specified limit or deviations are evaluated and dispositioned.

requirements.text: Commissioning shall demonstrate stable pressure control across representative operating conditions including load changes, charging/letdown variations, and startup/shutdown transitions.

verification.acceptance: Commissioning test results demonstrate stability and performance across defined scenarios without unacceptable oscillations.

requirements.text: Commissioning shall demonstrate stable level control across representative transients, including insurge/outsurge and spray events where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Level control performance meets acceptance criteria across defined scenarios; heater coverage is maintained.

requirements.text: Surveillance testing shall include periodic verification of alarms, interlocks, and permissives for heater and spray systems.

verification.acceptance: Surveillance test procedures and records demonstrate periodic verification is performed and meets acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Periodic testing and inspection shall verify heater electrical insulation resistance and detect degraded heater elements prior to failure.

verification.acceptance: Test results demonstrate insulation resistance within acceptable limits; degraded heaters are identified and corrected.

requirements.text: A periodic inspection program shall verify insulation condition, attachment integrity, and absence of moisture accumulation or corrosion under insulation.

verification.acceptance: Inspection program exists and records demonstrate periodic checks and corrective actions.

requirements.text: Instrumentation channel functional tests shall be designed to verify end-to-end response (sensor to final element) where practicable, or via partial-stroke/loop checks as appropriate.

verification.acceptance: Test strategy and records demonstrate end-to-end or equivalent verification for safety-significant loops.

requirements.text: Seismic qualification tests or analyses (as applicable) shall be documented for pressurizer I&C equipment required to function during/after seismic events.

verification.acceptance: Seismic qualification documentation exists and covers the installed configuration.

requirements.text: Initial chemistry verification shall confirm that pressurizer wetted surfaces are exposed only to coolant meeting specified impurity limits before entering service.

verification.acceptance: Startup chemistry records demonstrate compliance with specified limits prior to service; deviations are corrected.

requirements.text: A pressurizer operability test shall confirm venting and noncondensable management functionality during startup, including appropriate routing and controls.

verification.acceptance: Startup tests demonstrate effective venting/noncondensable management and controlled routing.

requirements.text: Tests shall verify that spray and relief discharge paths are properly vented/drained to mitigate water hammer risk.

verification.acceptance: Test results or inspections demonstrate vent/drain effectiveness for discharge paths.

requirements.text: Post-maintenance testing requirements shall be defined for heater replacement, instrumentation changes, or relief path maintenance to restore operability and verify setpoints.

verification.acceptance: PMT requirements exist in procedures and are verified during maintenance closeout.

requirements.text: Where applicable, online monitoring shall be used to detect abnormal pressurizer behavior (e.g., pressure oscillations, heater cycling, unexplained level changes) with defined thresholds and response actions.

verification.acceptance: Online monitoring strategy and thresholds are defined; alarms/trending support timely detection and response.

requirements.text: A periodic review shall compare actual pressurizer transient counts and severity against design assumptions to support fatigue management updates.

verification.acceptance: Periodic review process exists; records show comparison and actions when assumptions are exceeded.

requirements.text: For integral pressurizer designs, module-level testing shall verify pressurizer performance and interfaces under representative thermal-hydraulic conditions prior to site installation where practicable.

verification.acceptance: Module testing documentation demonstrates performance and interface verification; limitations are justified.

requirement_sets.category: 14. Inservice inspection, maintenance, ALARA, and lifecycle documentation

requirements.text: The pressurizer design shall provide access and clearances for ASME Section XI inservice inspections of required welds, nozzles, and penetrations.

verification.acceptance: ISI plan and layout demonstrate required inspection access; removable insulation and access ports are provided where needed.

requirements.text: ISI interval planning shall assume an inspection interval of {{isi_interval_years}} years (or per plant program) and include identification of examination methods and required access provisions.

verification.acceptance: ISI plan defines interval, methods, and access requirements consistent with plant program and code requirements.

requirements.text: Inspection and maintenance activities shall be planned to minimize personnel radiation exposure (ALARA), including shielding, remote tooling, and time-at-risk reductions where feasible.

verification.acceptance: ALARA considerations are incorporated into maintenance planning and design features; documentation demonstrates implementation.

requirements.text: Maintenance procedures shall define safe isolation, depressurization, and electrical lockout/tagout steps for heater and spray system maintenance.

verification.acceptance: Procedures include isolation/LOTO steps and are validated through walkdowns or demonstrations.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall provide features to support decontamination and cleanup, including smooth surfaces, drainability, and access for flushing as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Design features and procedures support decontamination/flush operations; drainability is verified by design review.

requirements.text: A spare parts and obsolescence management plan shall be maintained for pressurizer heaters, penetrations, key valves, and instrumentation.

verification.acceptance: Spare/obsolescence plan exists and is periodically reviewed; critical items are tracked and mitigations implemented.

requirements.text: Pressurizer insulation shall be maintainable (removable panels, reinstallation standards) and monitored for degradation that could affect heat loss, corrosion-under-insulation, or personnel safety.

verification.acceptance: Maintenance/inspection provisions and standards exist and are implemented; records demonstrate periodic evaluation.

requirements.text: Periodic verification of pressurizer setpoints and logic changes shall include independent review and validation, with configuration control records retained.

verification.acceptance: Setpoint/logic change packages include independent review and validation evidence and are retained under CM.

requirements.text: A functional test strategy for relief and isolation valves in the pressurizer relief path shall be implemented consistent with plant OM/IST programs where applicable.

verification.acceptance: IST/OM test scope and frequency are defined and implemented; test records demonstrate compliance.

requirements.text: Pressurizer heater replacement activities shall include inspection of heater sleeves, seals, and penetrations for wear, corrosion, or damage, with acceptance criteria defined.

verification.acceptance: Maintenance procedures require inspection and acceptance criteria; records demonstrate inspection results and dispositions.

requirements.text: The pressurizer shall include provisions for periodic inspection of spray nozzles and internal components for erosion, blockage, or degradation, with cleaning/replacement criteria defined.

verification.acceptance: Inspection provisions and criteria exist; records demonstrate inspections and corrective actions.

requirements.text: A program shall define acceptance criteria and corrective actions for abnormal trends in pressurizer behavior (e.g., increased heater cycling, unexplained level drift, relief chatter).

verification.acceptance: Condition monitoring program defines criteria and response actions; events are tracked and resolved.

requirements.text: Repair/replacement activities on pressure boundary components shall follow approved repair plans, qualified procedures, and required NDE with documentation suitable for code and regulatory compliance.

verification.acceptance: Repair packages include qualified procedures, NDE results, and approvals; records are retained and traceable.

requirements.text: Documentation turnover shall include as-built drawings, nozzle schedules, instrument lists, control logic descriptions, and maintenance manuals for lifecycle support.

verification.acceptance: Turnover package is complete and includes required as-built and O&M documentation; deficiencies are tracked to closure.

requirements.text: A periodic review shall verify continued applicability of codes/standards and code cases used for pressurizer ISI and repairs, including alignment with regulatory guide acceptability.

verification.acceptance: Periodic review and updates are documented; ISI/repair practices remain aligned with accepted code cases.

requirements.text: Training requirements shall be defined for operators and maintenance personnel for pressurizer-specific evolutions (heater management, spray control, venting, relief events).

verification.acceptance: Training materials and completion records demonstrate personnel are trained for required evolutions.

requirements.text: A plant procedure shall define safe depressurization and cooldown strategies that coordinate pressurizer actions with RCS cooldown to prevent thermal shock and water hammer.

verification.acceptance: Procedure exists and is validated against transient evaluations; controls prevent unacceptable shock/hammer.

requirements.text: Configuration baseline shall include a defined list of safety-significant components and settings (heaters, sensors, relief devices) that require enhanced change controls.

verification.acceptance: Baseline list exists and is used to trigger enhanced controls during changes and maintenance.

requirements.text: If pressurizer is integral, maintenance and inspection strategy shall document how required inspections are performed given module constraints and how repairs are executed.

verification.acceptance: Integral pressurizer maintenance/inspection strategy is documented and feasible; constraints and mitigations are defined.

requirements.text: A lessons-learned and event feedback process shall periodically update pressurizer maintenance practices, setpoints, and monitoring thresholds based on operating experience.

verification.acceptance: Operating experience feedback is reviewed periodically and results in tracked updates or documented no-change decisions.
